We are looking for a Senior Social-First Account Manager 
Ogilvy Social.Lab is looking for an Senior Account Manager, with a strong digital background, specialising in a social-first approach, to manage organic social deliverables, as well as developing and nurturing the relationship with our Verizon International client. 
This role involves meticulous planning and follow-up. Crucial to this position is a comprehensive understanding and deep appreciation of social media dynamics, including an in-depth knowledge of the main features, advantages, and limitations across major social platforms.  The role requires close collaboration with our strategy, creative and production team to deliver best in class content. 
Responsibilities 

Collaborate with clients to develop comprehensive organic social media strategies tailored to their objectives, target audience, and budget. 
Act as the clients trusted advisor by providing strategic guidance with insight into social media, particularly B2B, best practice and performance, providing opinions about the brief and the work and being keen to contribute. 


Manage the curation and development of content, with a specific B2B focus on LinkedIn.  


Ensure that the creative team/traffic manager/production manager/client are aligned throughout a project, to meet deadlines and coordinate workflow 


Lead clients projects and remain responsible for their daily management, while building strong relationships and fostering good team spirit with both clients and members of the agency to bring great ideas and creative work to life. 


Coordinate digital projects, specialising in organic social media, from briefing to delivery, including budget follow-up and planning. 


Ensure content is performing and effective on an on-going basis, leaning into the research and data team. 


Achieve and sustain client satisfaction by balancing client and agency needs.  


Maintain responsibility for any difficulties and finding solutions during the project while keeping your line manager (Project Director/Business Unit Director) informed throughout. 


Manage/coach junior Accounts where necessary.  


Manage the agencys billing system and be responsible for invoicing, and issuing POs, etc. with a clear understanding of the financial forecast/overview of your clients. 


Possess thorough working knowledge of all agency systems: plan briefings, reviews, follow planning procedures, etc. 


Ultimately responsible for ensuring work is produced efficiently, on time, and within budget. 

 
Qualifications and Experience 

A minimum of 4 years specialising in social media account management, preferable extending to 8 years in a client service environment. Experience of B2B organic social media, and knowledge of LinkedIn, is also an advantage.  


Strong understanding of various social media platforms, main features, their respective algorithms, and best practices for content creation and optimization. 


Proficiency in social media management tools and analytics platforms (e.g., Hootsuite, Sprout Social, Google Analytics). 


Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate ideas and strategies effectively. 


Skillful project management . 

 About you 
You are seeking a unique opportunity to work with some of the most talented individuals in the industry and contribute to the growth and success of our agency and its teams. You are a creative minded individual with a keen eye for orginisation and optimisation, and an enthusiastic team player. You are curious and keen to learn and grow.  
Offer 

Full-time job within a growing and trendsetting agency 
Global client portfolio   
Attractive package and benefits 
Continuous trainings. Career conversation and growing opportunities

The Role:
The Delivery Manager is a critical junior-level role within the Ogilvy Consulting team, reporting to the Senior Delivery Director. This role is responsible for supporting the smooth and efficient execution of client projects by ensuring seamless navigation through internal systems and processes. The Delivery Manager will be a critical part of a newly formed Operations team, working closely with project teams, resource, finance and other internal stakeholders to facilitate project setup, tracking, reporting, and closure. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly organised and detail-oriented individual to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced consulting environment, with opportunities to work across multiple Business Units for key clients.
 
Key Responsibilities:
Project Setup and Initiation:

Coordinate with the relevant consulting/project teams to formulate initial timeline, resource requirements for all new project requests.
Create the necessary project codes in the finance and resource systems for tracking purposes.
Support the team with the creation of the SOW, ensure the necessary commercial approvals have been received and upload to the necessary systems (Ogilvy and client systems).
Ensure all resource requests for all new projects are communicated to the Operations Resource Manager and time is allocated in Wrike accurately.
Track client approval of SOW and ensure billing requests of client POs are processed in a timely manner.
Support any new starters in the consulting with any necessary finance tasks e.g. training on how to book travel, process expenses, complete timesheets etc.

Project Tracking and Monitoring:

For select larger clients, maintain project schedules and timelines, tracking progress against key milestones and updating resource of any shifts in staff needs.
Alongside the Senior Delivery Director, oversee production requests for larger requirements, from deck design image creation to video production.
Support with the monitoring of all project SOW, running burn reports, against planned timelines, identifying potential overruns or discrepancies on a weekly basis.
Proactively identify and escalate potential project risks and issues to the Senior Delivery Director.

Internal Process Management:

Serve as a liaison between Consulting project teams and internal departments (e.g., finance, resource, production, legal).
Ensure compliance with Ogilvy's internal policies and procedures.
Work with the Senior Delivery Director and Operations Manager to streamline internal processes to improve project efficiency and effectiveness.
Support the implementation of new project management tools and methodologies.

New Business Support:

Support the development of new business proposals and pitches and ensuring any resource outside of consulting is communicated to the relevant Resource manager and recorded in Wrike.

 
Skills and Attributes:

Excellent organisation and time management skills with the ability to multi-task, especially in high-pressure situations.
Strong work ethic with superior attention to detail.
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint, Keynote a plus. Wrike and/or Workday experience an advantage.
A good understanding of basic production tasks such as overseeing design requests or working with a production team to create internal videos
A curiosity, energy and assertiveness that allows you to adopt a can-do attitude to every challenge and initiative.
Thrives in a changing, dynamic environment
Acts in a professional way while being able to make it fun.
Able to see the big picture while paying attention to the smallest details.
Anticipates and manages risk.
An instinctive collaborator and good communicator, able to develop strong working relationships with Consulting team members and wider internal stakeholders.
Pro-actively keeps people up to date, participates in meetings and helps problem solve.
